headline.main: PROME IS IMPERILED; Heavy Japanese Forces Press North on Both Banks of River AIR CONTROL TIPS SCALES Chinese Forced to Abandon Toungoo After Seven Days of Ceaseless Bombing PROME IMPERILED; BRITISH BREAK RING

lead_paragraph: LONDON, April 1 -- The increasing gravity of the situation in Burma is apparent from today's communiques, despite the success of British and Chinese units in fighting their way out of encirclement below Prome and at Toungoo, respectively, and rejoining their main forces on new defense lines.

byline.original: By DAVID ANDERSONSpecial Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES
